instructions.display_text: Mix all ingredients in a bowl until well-combined.
Cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Once done chilling, roll into approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm) balls. (Cover hands in a light layer of butter or oil to facilitate rolling and avoid getting sticky hands.)

Lay out a thin layer of oats and chocolate chips on a cutting board or work surface and roll the balls in the mixture. Finish off by rolling each ball between your hands to pack in the oats and chocolate chips.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: 1 cup old-fashioned oats, plus extra for rolling
1/4 cup miniature chocolate chips, plus extra for rolling

compilations.name: Protein-Packed Snacks To Keep You Going Through The Day
High Protein Snacks For A Healthy Lifestyle

compilations.description: Exam season is, well, stressful: stress studying, stress coffee-guzzling, and stress-eating. We know it ALL too well, and we're here to help fuel those late night cram sessions with some much needed protein. Power through another lecture with our creamy Java Chip Milkshakeand munch on some healthy Spicy Roasted Chickpeas to keep yourself ready to crush it. We bet you'll love 'em as much as we do!
compilations.name: Recipes To Get You Through Your Exams

compilations.description: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day and well, what better way to start off your morning than with a treat? Test out our fruity and refreshing or some to get the true taste of a delicious and fulfilling breakfast! We love these all so much, it's hard to pick a favorite.
compilations.name: Breakfast You Cannot Get Enough Of!
Healthy Desserts For Fitness Freaks
compilations.description: Try these healthy takes on some truly drool-worthy desserts that we've curated, just for you! Indulge in some fudgy guilt-free Brownies or stuff your face with a plate of healthy blueberry crisp – you can even top it off with a scoop of chocolate chip peanut butter froyo if you're feeling fancy. The best part: these desserts indulge your body, mind, and soul! Your sweet tooth's calling: it's time to satisfy it.

Wake up in the morning and heat up last nights pizza? Is that you? Dont worry we have you covered! Start your day the healthy way by eating right! Your new day deserves and fresh and healthy start and with peanut-butter-energy-bites or why not try our healthier-fried-rice the options are endless!
compilations.name: A Healthy Start To Your Day!

compilations.description: Make your mornings easier with these prep-ahead breakfast bites! Start sweet with Peanut Butter Energy Bites or Muesli Muffins, or stick to savory with Egg Cups or Turkey Sausage and Pepper Muffins. Whatever you choose, you'll be glad you did when you can grab and go on your way out the door!
compilations.name: 5 Make-Ahead Morning Snacks Because You're Always Running Late

results.description: High-protein recipes are the secret to healthy-yet-filling meals that won’t leave you hungry later. This foil pack chicken and rainbow veggies recipe requires minimal prep and only 30 minutes of cooking time. If you’re in the mood for a protein-rich salad, this tomato, avocado, and egg version only takes three ingredients and one step: mixing everything in a bowl. Can’t get much easier than that!

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 400°F/200˚C.
Place red onion, broccoli, yellow bell pepper, baby carrots, and cherry tomatoes evenly on a baking tray. (Try not to let the vegetables overlap too much so they roast properly.)
Season with olive oil, salt, and pepper (to taste).
Add sprigs of thyme and garlic clove halves on top of the vegetables.
Tear off four pieces of aluminum foil, approximately 12 in x 12 in (30 x 30 cm).
Lay down the foil and place the chicken breast in the center for each one.
Season both sides of the chicken with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika (all to taste).
Add sprigs of thyme and garlic clove on top of each chicken breast.
Bring the top and bottom edge of the foil into the center and fold a couple of times. Fold in the left and right sides a couple of times to seal the foil pack.
Place all 4 chicken foil packs on a baking tray.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Enjoy!

recipes.keywords: baked, chicken, oven, roasted, tasty, vegetables

compilations.name: New Year, New Me: High Protein Meals
compilations.description: High-protein recipes are the secret to healthy-yet-filling meals that won’t leave you hungry later. This foil pack chicken and rainbow veggies recipe requires minimal prep and only 30 minutes of cooking time. If you’re in the mood for a protein-rich salad, this tomato, avocado, and egg version only takes three ingredients and one step: mixing everything in a bowl. Can’t get much easier than that!

compilations.name: Colorful Recipes You Should Make
compilations.description: We know that sometimes life can be a montone rut. Well, we're here to help you change that! What better way to add color to life than your food? Let the vibrant colors of the Foil Pack Chicken & Rainbow Veggies take you by surprise and if that's not enough, try the simply mouthwatering Rainbow Cereal Cheesecake. A dash of color never hurt anyone! Go ahead, try your favorite colorful recipes and tell us: what's your top pick?

recipes.name: Foil Pack Chicken And Rainbow Veggies

compilations.description: Snacking can be a healthy and satisfying way to not get hangry between meals. These easy-to-make protein snacks will fill you up and keep you energized when you need it. Try a fresh and vibrant protein-packed salad recipe, or if you’re craving something sweeter, these delicious peanut butter energy balls are ready in 30 minutes.
compilations.name: 6 Easy High-Protein Snacks (Under 150 Calories)
New Year, New Me: High Protein Meals
compilations.description: High-protein recipes are the secret to healthy-yet-filling meals that won’t leave you hungry later. This foil pack chicken and rainbow veggies recipe requires minimal prep and only 30 minutes of cooking time. If you’re in the mood for a protein-rich salad, this tomato, avocado, and egg version only takes three ingredients and one step: mixing everything in a bowl. Can’t get much easier than that!

compilations.name: 3 Ingredient Recipes For An Entire Week
compilations.description: Having trouble meal-prepping? Not to fear, we've brought you a weekly meal plan for an entire week with just 3 ingredients for each dish. For instance, tuck into a hearty Tomato Avocado Egg Salad for a cozy Sunday at home. Take a glance and let us know which ones are your favorites!

You can never go wrong with avocado, and these easy mouthwatering recipes can enjoyed at any time of the day. Start your day with a wholesome Raddish Avocado Toast or enjoy a Salmon Crab Seafood Stack on a lunch date with your special someone. But why settle for one when you have 31 options to try from? Avo-fun for the whole month!
compilations.name: 31 Days 31 Avocado Recipes
Everything You Can Make With Boiled Eggs
compilations.description: Eggs are cheap, easy, nutritious, and filling. And you can jazz them up into a gourmet meal. Blend egg yolks with avocado to make fancy deviled eggs. And our tomato, avocado and egg salad is a protein-packed, good-for-you meal you'll crave all the time. These meals are worth getting egg-cited about.
compilations.thumbnail_alt_text: Everything You Can Make With Boiled Eggs

instructions.display_text: Combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
Mix until combined. Serve.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: 1 pound sirloin steak, about ½ inch thick

compilations.name: New Year, New Me: High Protein Meals

The Keto diet is a popular low-carb, high-fat plan that can allow your body to burn fat for energy. Navigating a new diet and all its rules is always tricky, but we’re here to help! From a super filling and satisfying beef and veggie stir-fry to quick and easy baked avocado eggs, these Ketogenic diet recipes will show you how to satisfy your cravings in a completely Keto-friendly way.
compilations.name: 6 Keto-Friendly Meals
9 Juicy Gourmet Steak Recipes You Can Make At Home

compilations.description: Craving keto snacks? You've come to the right place! These are totally keto-friendly and delicious at the same time: what could be better? Try the garlic and herb mashed cauliflower or the caprese avocado bowls. You can't go wrong with either.
compilations.name: Have These Keto Snacks Without Guilt

compilations.description: The thought of going Keto might be daunting but with our compilation of lipsmacking meals, it's as easy as 1, 2, and 3! We’ve curated absolute best Keto-friendly meals for an entire week, just for you. Start with a filling Fajita Chicken Bake and work your way up to the impressive Keto Lasagna Dome. Take a glance and let us know which ones are your favorites!
compilations.name: Keto Meals To Get You Through The Week
Recipes For Avo Cardio Lovers!
compilations.description: We've curated some 'avo-rable' recipes for all green goddesses out there because, well, avocados never go out of style! Kick off your morning with a hearty and healthy Cheddar & Chive Avocado Egg. If you want to spruce things up, test out a nutrient-packed Avocado Quinoa Power Salad. We've got just the right recipes to celebrate everyone's favorite green superfood (don't worry, we won't tell kale if you won't).

You can never go wrong with avocado, and these easy mouthwatering recipes can enjoyed at any time of the day. Start your day with a wholesome Raddish Avocado Toast or enjoy a Salmon Crab Seafood Stack on a lunch date with your special someone. But why settle for one when you have 31 options to try from? Avo-fun for the whole month!
compilations.name: 31 Days 31 Avocado Recipes

instructions.display_text: Salt and pepper the steak on both sides, being sure to rub in the seasoning.
Heat the oil in a pan over high heat until slightly smoking.
Sear the steak for about 2 minutes per side.
Rest the steak on a cutting board for 10 minutes.
Slice the steak.
In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, eggs, avocados, cherry tomatoes, steak, and dressing.
Toss the salad until evenly coated and serve.
Enjoy!
In a bowl, mix oat flour, protein powder, baking powder, and cinnamon until fully blended.
Add egg whites and Greek yogurt to the bowl and mix until a batter-like consistency is reached.
Melt coconut oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and wipe down to prevent the pancakes from sticking.
Pour in some batter and cook pancakes until bubbles form all around the top of the pancake, then flip and cook for a few more minutes, or until cooked through.
Top your pancake stack with bananas, blueberries, or honey.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: High-protein recipes are the secret to healthy-yet-filling meals that won’t leave you hungry later. This foil pack chicken and rainbow veggies recipe requires minimal prep and only 30 minutes of cooking time. If you’re in the mood for a protein-rich salad, this tomato, avocado, and egg version only takes three ingredients and one step: mixing everything in a bowl. Can’t get much easier than that!
compilations.name: New Year, New Me: High Protein Meals

compilations.description: Who knew there were enough different kinds of pancakes for you to eat through the entire month without getting bored? We did! Dig into a mix of sweet and savory pancakes for breakfast... or dinner because pancakes can be eaten at any time of the day!
compilations.name: Pancakes For The Entire Month

compilations.description: Summer has brought in your inner gym rat, but before you go turning into The Rock, you need to amp up those muscles with a protein-packed diet. Our protein powder-infused vanilla pancakes are a great way to start your morning and skip the dull-tasting protein shakes. For something more on-the-go, we recommend our loaded quesarito. Want a protein-packed nutritious meal? Look no further than our spice-rubbed flank steak. Those muscles may not build themselves but with our menu additions, you'll be flaunting those gains in no time.
compilations.name: Protein-packed Meals For All The Gains
New Year, New Me: High Protein Meals
compilations.description: High-protein recipes are the secret to healthy-yet-filling meals that won’t leave you hungry later. This foil pack chicken and rainbow veggies recipe requires minimal prep and only 30 minutes of cooking time. If you’re in the mood for a protein-rich salad, this tomato, avocado, and egg version only takes three ingredients and one step: mixing everything in a bowl. Can’t get much easier than that!

compilations.name: 6 Meals To Help You Live Healthy

compilations.description: You can never have too many easy protein-packed recipes in your kitchen roster. These simple yet satisfying dishes — like a high-protein Buddha bowl with chickpeas and roasted sweet potatoes, or a family-friendly vegetarian chili that you can freeze for later — come together quickly. These recipes also all work equally well as a pack-and-prep lunch or a busy weeknight dinner option.
compilations.name: Quick And Delicious High Protein Meals
12 Creamy & Crunchy Salads To Enjoy This Summer
10 Power Salads For A Healthy Lifestyle
New Year's Eve Date Night In
compilations.description: Celebrate new years eve with flavor! Prepare a fancy dinner for that special someone and indulge in lovely conversations over a roasted shrimp veggie salad. Make plans for the new year over a chicken cordon bleu bake and don't forget to end the year on a sweet note with chocolate strawberry cream puffs.

compilations.name: Salads For Each Day Of The Week

compilations.description: Thinking you want to switch into super healthy mode for a few weeks? We have got you covered for an entire month! Start your February with a super delicious protein-packed Buddha bowl, then have banana pancakes on first Sunday of the week. Stop brainstorming about what to eat and dig in and fill your mouth with these healthy and amazing recipes.
compilations.name: 28 Healthy Recipes For February
Busy Schedule? Whip These Lunches Up In Less Than 30 Minutes
compilations.description: Super hungry but too busy to cook? These insanely easy lunches will keep all your hunger pangs at bay. From the shrimp and asparagus stir fry to the filling one-pot Chinese fried rice, you can whip up these mouthwatering (and fool-proof!) meals in no time.

Work days are feeling long, but we need you to keep powering through, so we think we have just the thing: A whole list of lunches that'll satisfy every mid-day craving. From mouth-watering Chinese-style lemon chicken to vegan pesto pasta, these recipes will definitely make your (work) day.
compilations.name: Tasty's Top 23 Lunches
Recipes To Help Your Summer Body
compilations.description: The season of beaches is here! And we know that a lot of you would be hitting gyms soon. But no worries because we're here to give you a stress-free journey on the dietary front. From easy Flatbread Chips to some flavorful Chicken & Veggies Stir Fry, summer of surfing just got a whole lot easier and whole lot healthier!

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 400˚F (200˚C).
Add cut vegetables to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle in olive oil and sprinkle with seasonings to your preference. Bake for 10 minutes.
Move veggies to the side to make space in the center of the baking sheet and add shrimp in a single layer.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with seasonings and lime juice to your preference. Bake for 5-8 minutes, until shrimp is fully cooked. Be careful not to overcook.
Mix dressing ingredients together in a small bowl.
In a large salad bowl, combine mixed greens, roasted shrimp, veggies, and vinaigrette dressing together.
Enjoy!

Add in remaining ingredients and blend until smooth.

compilations.name: 6 High Protein Vegetarian Dinners
compilations.description: From vegetarian black bean burgers to plant-powered Buddha bowls, these easy meat-free meals will warm you up and keep you fueled for hours. All of them are high in protein and you can mix and match ingredients depending on what you have handy in the fridge or pantry. They’re perfect for your next Meatless Monday dinner or meal-prepped lunch!

compilations.name: Get Plenty Of Protein Without Meat Or Dairy
6 Meals To Help You Live Healthy

compilations.description: You can never have too many easy protein-packed recipes in your kitchen roster. These simple yet satisfying dishes — like a high-protein Buddha bowl with chickpeas and roasted sweet potatoes, or a family-friendly vegetarian chili that you can freeze for later — come together quickly. These recipes also all work equally well as a pack-and-prep lunch or a busy weeknight dinner option.
compilations.name: Quick And Delicious High Protein Meals

compilations.description: If you are looking to add some colorful flavor to your everyday meals, these delicious protein-packed Buddha bowls are just for you! Try our craveable energy-boosting bowl or the scrumpious Buffalo chicken bowl. You can always mix it up with a dressing or sauce of your choice and happily devour. But wait, just before you eat, make your sure to keep you phone handy for those beautiful Instagram shots!
compilations.name: Nutrituous Buddha Bowls
High Protein Snacks For A Healthy Lifestyle
28 Healthy Recipes For February
compilations.description: Thinking you want to switch into super healthy mode for a few weeks? We have got you covered for an entire month! Start your February with a super delicious protein-packed Buddha bowl, then have banana pancakes on first Sunday of the week. Stop brainstorming about what to eat and dig in and fill your mouth with these healthy and amazing recipes.

Craving Asian food — but want to keep it vegan? Test out some of our most-popular vegan creations, from the shiitake veggie rolls to a nutrient-dense tofu and quinoa-loaded vegan buddha bowl. We've even got a vegan ramen, and an authentic vegan curry dish to impress your dinner guests, vegan or not. Let's get cooking!
compilations.name: Homemade Asian-Inspired Vegan Meals
Protein-packed Meals For All The Gains
compilations.description: Summer has brought in your inner gym rat, but before you go turning into The Rock, you need to amp up those muscles with a protein-packed diet. Our protein powder-infused vanilla pancakes are a great way to start your morning and skip the dull-tasting protein shakes. For something more on-the-go, we recommend our loaded quesarito. Want a protein-packed nutritious meal? Look no further than our spice-rubbed flank steak. Those muscles may not build themselves but with our menu additions, you'll be flaunting those gains in no time.

Buddha Bowls are all the rage these days and for all the right reasons! They're low-lift, super-delicious and will fill your tummy right up! So, what if we said, you could try a Buddha bowl for each day of the week?! Mondays are hard enough, you don't want to be running low on energy - test out the Energy Boosting Buddha Bowl and conquer the day! On a more relaxed day, try the mouthwatering Crispy Chickpea Buddha Bowl. We bet these Buddha bowls will lift your spirits right up!
compilations.name: Buddha Bowls For An Entire Week
Vegan Meals To Get You Through The Day
compilations.description: Whether you are newly vegan, a seasoned veteran, or just trying out some meatless recipes, you need to try these meals. A refreshing cucumber, tomato, and avocado salad is a quick and easy lunch to bring to school or work. For cooler evenings, we love this eggplant, potato, and tomato stew or our veggie-packed, one-pot split pea soup. These plant-based meals are anything but boring.

instructions.display_text: Make the marinade: In a small bowl, combine the vegetable oil, sesame oil, hot sauce, thyme, paprika, and salt. Set aside.
Add the marinade and tofu to a container and marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to a day.
Preheat the oven to 400ºF (200ºC).
Lay the sweet potato, onion, and garlic on a baking sheet and drizzle with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20-25 minutes.
In a medium bowl, add the chickpeas, salt, pepper, chili powder, and garlic powder to a bowl and stir to combine.
Transfer chickpeas to a skillet and cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes. Set chickpeas aside.
Fry the tofu in the same pan for about 10 minutes on each side.
Slice tofu to your preference.
Combine the quinoa, greens, sweet potatoes, onions, chickpeas, carrots, tofu, and avocado in a medium-large bowl and top off with lemon juice
Enjoy!

components.extra_comment: such as mesclun, baby kale, or spinach

From mouth-watering Chinese-style lemon chicken to vegan pesto pasta, these recipes will definitely make your (work) day.

The season of beaches is here! And we know that a lot of you would be hitting gyms soon. But no worries because we're here to give you a stress-free journey on the dietary front. From easy Flatbread Chips to some flavorful Chicken & Veggies Stir Fry, summer of surfing just got a whole lot easier and whole lot healthier!
compilations.name: Recipes To Help Your Summer Body

instructions.display_text: In a bowl, mix oat flour, protein powder, baking powder, and cinnamon until fully blended.
Add egg whites and Greek yogurt to the bowl and mix until a batter-like consistency is reached.
Melt coconut oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and wipe down to prevent the pancakes from sticking.
Pour in some batter and cook pancakes until bubbles form all around the top of the pancake, then flip and cook for a few more minutes, or until cooked through.
Top your pancake stack with bananas, blueberries, or honey.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: High-protein recipes are the secret to healthy-yet-filling meals that won’t leave you hungry later. This foil pack chicken and rainbow veggies recipe requires minimal prep and only 30 minutes of cooking time. If you’re in the mood for a protein-rich salad, this tomato, avocado, and egg version only takes three ingredients and one step: mixing everything in a bowl. Can’t get much easier than that!
compilations.name: New Year, New Me: High Protein Meals
Pancakes For The Entire Month
compilations.description: Who knew there were enough different kinds of pancakes for you to eat through the entire month without getting bored? We did! Dig into a mix of sweet and savory pancakes for breakfast... or dinner because pancakes can be eaten at any time of the day!

compilations.name: Protein-packed Meals For All The Gains
compilations.description: Summer has brought in your inner gym rat, but before you go turning into The Rock, you need to amp up those muscles with a protein-packed diet. Our protein powder-infused vanilla pancakes are a great way to start your morning and skip the dull-tasting protein shakes. For something more on-the-go, we recommend our loaded quesarito. Want a protein-packed nutritious meal? Look no further than our spice-rubbed flank steak. Those muscles may not build themselves but with our menu additions, you'll be flaunting those gains in no time.
